name: Světlé Výčepní

It has become an essential part of Czech culture and lifestyle, embodying centuries-old brewing traditions.

description: Bernard Světlý Výčepní is a Czech pale lager from Rodinný pivovar Bernard, characterized by its classic Pilsner style. It has an alcohol content of 3.8% ABV, making it a lighter, easy-drinking beer with a crisp, refreshing taste. The beer features a balanced malt sweetness and a mild hop bitterness, delivering a smooth, clean finish. It's an ideal choice for quenching thirst on a warm day or as a session beer. This beer is typically presented in a bright golden color with a nice, creamy white head​

name: Bernard Свětlý Ležák
description: Bernard Světlý Ležák is a Czech pale lager with an alcohol content of 4.7% ABV. It is a traditional Czech Pilsner style beer brewed by Rodinný pivovar Bernard. The beer is known for its clean, golden appearance and balanced malt sweetness with a slight bitterness, offering a pleasant, herbal hop finish

name: Bernard Свětlý Ležак
description: Bernard Světlý Ležák is a Czech pale lager with an alcohol content of 4.9% ABV. It is a traditional Czech Pilsner style beer brewed by Rodinný pivovar Bernard. The beer is known for its clean, golden appearance and balanced malt sweetness with a slight bitterness, offering a pleasant, herbal hop finish

name: Bernard Speciální Ležák 14% OX
description: Bernard Speciální Ležák 14% OX is a strong, Czech-style pale lager characterized by its robust flavor and slightly sweet taste profile. It features a balanced combination of maltiness with a hint of bitterness from the hops, offering a smooth drinking experience with a clean finish. The beer has an alcohol content of 5.8%, making it one of the stronger options in the Bernard portfolio​

name: Chodovar Zlatý Ležák
description: Chodovar Zlatý Ležák is a classic Czech lager with a bright golden color and a slightly malty flavor profile. It is a bottom-fermented lager that embodies the typical characteristics of Czech lagers from the West Bohemia region. The beer features a mild hop aroma with a slight bitterness at the finish, making it a versatile choice that pairs well with traditional Czech dishes such as roast meats and pasta

name: Chodovar Pašerák Světlé
description: Chodovar Pašerák Světlé is a Czech lager-style beer brewed by Chodovar, a family-owned brewery in Chodová Planá. This beer is classified as a bottom-fermented light lager, and it is known for its refreshing, balanced taste with a mild bitterness and a slight sweetness. The beer undergoes a dry-hopping process during maturation, which contributes to its aromatic hop character. It is an ideal choice for quenching thirst on warm days or accompanying light meals. With an alcohol content of about 5.1%, it maintains a smooth drinkability.

name: Chodovar Prezident Premium
description: Chodovar Prezident Premium is a classic Czech pale lager brewed by the Chodovar Brewery. This beer is a representative of traditional Czech lager style, characterized by a bright golden color, pleasant hop aroma, and a smooth malt taste with a subtle bitterness. It is brewed with water from an artesian well, Czech hops, and locally sourced barley malt. This lager is known for its well-balanced flavor profile that pairs well with traditional Czech dishes such as roast meat and pasta​

name: Chodovar Zámecký Ležák Special
description: Chodovar Zámecký Ležák Special is a Czech-style Pilsner brewed by Chodovar in the Chodová Planá region. It is a bright golden lager characterized by a distinct hop bouquet and a full malt flavor with a gentle bitterness. The beer undergoes a fermentation period of 2 to 3 months in lager casks within Chodovar's unique rock cellar, enhancing its quality and providing it with a smooth, well-balanced taste.

name: Chodovar Černá Desítka [Dark Lager]
description: Chodovar Černá Desítka is a Czech dark lager, known for its rich, dark color and robust flavor profile typical of the Dunkel style. It features prominent notes of toffee, coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate, and a subtle bitterness that balances the sweetness from the malt. This beer has an alcohol content of 4.2% and is brewed using traditional Czech ingredients such as malt from Bohemian and Bavarian barley, Czech hops, and water from Chodovar’s own artesian well

name: Guinness Draught
description: Guinness Draught is known for its distinctive and balanced flavor profile. It features a malty sweetness with subtle hoppy bitterness, complemented by notes of coffee and chocolate due to roasted barley. The beer has a creamy, velvety mouthfeel, thanks to the use of nitrogen during fermentation which creates smaller, smoother bubbles compared to traditional carbon dioxide carbonation. Its lighter body and relatively low alcohol content (4.2% ABV) make it a popular choice for those seeking a sessionable beer.

name: Guinness Foreign Extra
description: Guinness Foreign Extra Stout is a robust and bold stout with a rich history and distinctive flavor profile. Originally brewed to withstand long sea voyages to Africa, Asia, and the Americas, it features a higher hop rate and stronger alcohol content compared to the standard Guinness Draught. This beer pours a deep, opaque mahogany color with a hint of red-orange and is topped with a thick, pock-marked foam. Its aroma combines roasted malt with notes of dark chocolate, caramel, and dried fruits, complemented by smoky and peppery hop bitterness​

name: Kilkenny
description: Kilkenny is an Irish Cream Ale known for its smooth, rich, and creamy profile. It features a deep red color with a thick, creamy head that is characteristic of this style. The flavor profile of Kilkenny combines sweet malt with light toffee and mild bitterness, creating a balanced and easy-drinking beer. It has a smooth, almost milky texture that makes it particularly enjoyable on draught. This beer is part of the Smithwick's family, and while it shares some similarities with other Irish ales, it stands out due to its creamy mouthfeel and deep amber hue

name: Smithwick's
description: Smithwick's is an Irish Red Ale brewed by Guinness Ltd. It features a rich ruby color with a creamy head. The aroma is malty with notes of toasted bread and toffee, complemented by light floral hops and a hint of orange. The flavor profile is balanced with a mild bitterness from the hops, a soft caramel sweetness, and a roasted dry finish

name: Murphy's Irish Red|Murphy's Red
description: Murphy's Irish Red is an Irish Red Ale with a smooth character and a vibrant red color, characterized by a balanced profile of malt sweetness and a subtle hop bitterness. It has an ABV of around 5.0% and is noted for its caramel malt flavors with hints of toffee and roasted nuts. The beer is brewed with a blend of malt varieties including Munich, 2-row, and roasted barley, contributing to its deep red hue and a malty backbone

name: Murphy's Irish Stout
description: Murphy's Irish Stout is a classic Irish dry stout brewed by Heineken Ireland in Cork, Ireland, since 1856. It is characterized by its dark, jet-black color and medium body, with a creamy texture and a smooth finish. The flavor profile is balanced, featuring subtle toffee and coffee undertones with minimal bitterness, making it a pleasant and sessionable option. The beer maintains a low carbonation level, which contributes to its easy-drinking nature

name: O'Hara's Irish Red
description: O'Hara's Irish Red is a traditional Irish Red Ale brewed by Carlow Brewing Company in Bagenalstown, County Carlow, Ireland. It has an ABV of 4.3% and a balanced bitterness with caramel tones, making it smoother and more complex than mainstream counterparts. The beer presents a copper-red color with a creamy, off-white head and exhibits roasted barley flavors mixed with subtle fruity notes like dark berries. It is lightly hopped with a slight bitterness that provides a pleasant finish

name: O'Hara's Irish Stout
description: O'Hara's Irish Stout is a classic Irish dry stout brewed by Carlow Brewing Company in Ireland. It has a moderate alcohol content of 4.3% ABV, making it a sessionable beer with a relatively light body for the style. This stout offers a robust roasted malt character, complemented by hints of coffee and dark chocolate. The aroma is slightly sweet with notes of roasted coffee beans and cream coffee, and on the palate, it delivers toasty flavors with a bittersweet finish​

name: Galway Hooker Irish Pale Ale
description: Galway Hooker Irish Pale Ale is a classic American Pale Ale style beer brewed by Galway Hooker Brewery in Oranmore, County Galway, Ireland. It has an alcohol by volume (ABV) of 4.3% and an International Bitterness Unit (IBU) of 35, giving it a balanced bitterness with a satisfying citrus aftertaste. The beer is crafted using a combination of pearl and crystal malts, along with Saaz and Cascade hops, which contribute to its deep golden color and a slightly caramel note akin to an Irish red beer​

name: Porterhouse Oyster Stout
description: Porterhouse Oyster Stout is a unique variation of the traditional stout, crafted by the Porterhouse Brewing Company in Dublin, Ireland. This Irish Dry Stout includes oysters in the brewing process, which imparts a subtle briny character and enhances the beer's smooth, creamy mouthfeel. The addition of oysters is designed to complement the stout's rich malt flavors, adding a depth of complexity and a slight mineral note to the profile. This beer typically showcases chocolate, roasted malt, and coffee flavors, combined with a hint of saltiness from the oysters. The result is a balanced, distinctive stout that pairs well with seafood and hearty dishes​

name: Wrasslers XXXX Stout
description: Wrasslers XXXX Stout is a robust Irish Dry Stout crafted by Porterhouse Brewing Company in Dublin, Ireland. With an alcohol content of 5%, it stands out for its full-bodied profile, balancing roasted grain flavors, a distinct malty sweetness, and a pronounced hoppy bitterness. Its deep, dark appearance is complemented by a complex aroma created from kettle hops, flaked barley, and roasted malts, delivering a smooth and satisfying drinking experience. This stout is described as reminiscent of the traditional, more robust Guinness recipes of the past, offering a richer and rounder body. It pays homage to classic Irish brewing traditions and has historical significance as it was reportedly a favorite of Michael Collins, a prominent Irish revolutionary leader

name: Paulaner Hefe-Weißbier Naturtrüb
description: Paulaner Hefe-Weißbier Naturtrüb is a classic unfiltered wheat beer (Hefeweizen) brewed by Paulaner Brauerei in Munich, Germany. With an alcohol content of 5.5% ABV, this beer is known for its slightly cloudy appearance due to suspended yeast. Its flavor profile combines a natural sweetness with notes of banana, clove, and subtle citrus, complemented by a bready malt character. The beer has a refreshing, crisp mouthfeel with lively carbonation and a smooth finish, making it a top choice among wheat beers worldwide. Often referred to as the 'benchmark' of its style, it is crafted using a traditional yeast suspension technique to ensure a consistently high-quality experience. This beer is widely enjoyed and ranks as one of the most popular wheat beers globally

name: Vormann Pils
description: Vormann Pils, brewed by Vormann Privatbrauerei, is a traditional German Pilsner. This beer is noted for its crisp and refreshing profile, characterized by a balance of mild malt sweetness and a moderate bitterness. It has a clean and light body, typical of the Pilsner style, making it a popular choice among those who enjoy straightforward, classic lagers. The taste highlights subtle hop flavors, which contribute to its pleasant bitterness and refreshing finish​

name: Alt aus Dahl
description: Alt aus Dahl is a dark, top-fermented Altbier brewed by Vormann Privat-Brauerei. It features a 5.0% ABV with a smooth and slightly fruity character. Its flavor profile includes notes of roasted malt, caramel, and subtle fruitiness, with a gentle bitterness and a hint of acidity that balances the beer well. The aroma often carries hints of malt, dark fruits, and even a touch of cherry. The beer has a medium body, making it particularly drinkable and a standout example of its style outside Düsseldorf​

name: Vormann Malz
description: Vormann Malz is a non-alcoholic malt beverage crafted by the Vormann Brauerei, a German brewery known for its traditional brewing heritage dating back to 1877. This drink is made with high-quality barley malt, hops, and water, offering a rich and smooth malt profile. Its taste features a balance of caramel sweetness with light roasted notes, creating a satisfying and refreshing flavor. While it contains 1.5% alcohol, it is often considered a lighter alternative to typical malt drinks or sugary sodas.

name: Sauerländer Weizenbier
description: The Vormann Sauerländer Weizenbier is a traditional wheat beer brewed by Vormann Brauerei in Hagen-Dahl, North Rhine-Westphalia. This beer is top-fermented, naturally cloudy, and has a 5.0% ABV with an original gravity of 11.7° Plato. It combines light wheat malt and barley malt, resulting in a refreshing, flavorful profile. Key notes include a mild sweetness, a malty aftertaste, and a subtle hint of banana aroma, characteristic of traditional Weissbiers. The fine hop balance comes exclusively from natural hop cones, and the beer undergoes bottle conditioning to achieve its distinct carbonation and taste

name: Vormann Doppelbock
description: The Vormann Doppelbock is a strong, bottom-fermented beer with 8% ABV and a specific gravity of 19.3° Plato. It is characterized by a malty, robust flavor profile, often described as sweet and slightly herbal, with a gentle bitterness in the finish. The beer has a distinctive amber to chestnut color and is traditionally brewed with Dolden aroma hops. This Doppelbock has a long six-month aging process to enhance its quality and flavor. It was first developed in the 1950s by Eduard Vormann and is brewed primarily from first wort, which adds to its unique character. It is available seasonally: as a Herbstbock (autumn bock) from October and as a Maibock (May bock) from April​

name: Vormann Vorderbier
description: Vormann Vorderbier is a dark lager-style Export beer brewed by Vormann Brauerei in Hagen-Dahl, Germany. A standout feature of this beer is the exclusive use of 'Vorderwürze' (first wort), the initial, most concentrated extract from the mashing process, without dilution from additional sparging. This method gives the beer a richer and more intense flavor profile. It is crafted using Munich malt and Tettnanger aroma hops, resulting in a malty and caramel-forward taste with subtle bitterness.

name: Dahler Urbräu
description: Typically bottom-fermented, slim, yet hoppy with a pronounced hop flower, which is caused by the secret recipe of various “highly fine aromatic varieties”.

name: Jever Pilsener
description: This clear blonde coloured pilsener has sweet, grassy and herby aromas, with a touch of citrus while the taste is a wonderful blend of herby, dry hop, and more citrus. The finish is long, crisp and clean with a slight resinous note.

name: Tyskie Gronie
description: Tyskie Gronie is one of the most frequently chosen beers by Poles. Very well known also abroad. Its popularity is due to its golden color, mild, hoppy aroma, perfect foam and classic, well-balanced taste - between sweetness and bitterness. It is recommended to drink very chilled.

name: Żywiec IPA
description: Żywiec Session IPA beer is characterised by a pleasant hoppy bitterness and distinct notes of exotic fruits and citrus. It is cold hopped with a unique composition of American hops. Optimum serving temperature: 9 – 12 degrees celcius. The brand’s icon, the so-called dancing couple, is one of the most recognisable and at the same time the most valuable trademarks on the Polish market; it is also the best known Polish beer abroad. The dancing couple refers to the pre-war tradition of placing folklore elements on Polish trademarks and in advertisements for the Archduke Brewery in Żywiec. Żywiec has been a patron of culture for years. It sponsors a number of artistic endeavours, including one of the most popular and recognised music events in Poland – the Męskie Granie concert tour.

name: Okocim Premium
description: Lager type beer with a distinct, strong hop flavor. It is characterized by thick and high foam. This beer has a uniquely subtle taste and smell, and is always made from the highest quality products and mountain spring water. Okocim O.K. is recognized both in Poland and the United States as Stawski's Beer due to the label on the neck and the neck of the bottle itself.

name: Perła Chmielowa
description: Perła Chmielowa beer is distinguished by a strong and pleasant smell of aromatic hops. Its characteristic bitter taste, which comes from the use of only natural ingredients, makes it appreciated even by the most demanding beer lovers.

name: Łomża Export
description: Łomża Export is a light beer with an alcohol content of 5.7% by volume. The name Export is a reference to the presence of the Łomża brand on foreign markets, especially in the United States, where it has been exported since 1997. The packaging of Łomża Export attracts attention with its elegance and gives the beer a very aspirational character, meeting the requirements of the consumer groups to which the product is addressed.

name: Lech Premium
description: Lech Premium is a pale lager that provides a perfect harmony of taste and appropriate carbonation, and therefore excellent refreshment – especially when properly cooled. Perfect for every occasion, always when you need refreshment.

name: Warka Strong
description: Warka Strong beer is a lager with a higher alcohol content (6.3%), which classifies it in the strong beer segment. It is characterised by an original malt and hop flavour and a beautiful deep amber colour.

name: Żywiec Porter
description: Żywiec Porter beer is a very strong and full-bodied beer with an aftertaste of roasted malt with coffee and caramel notes. Dark Beer brewed in Żywiec since 1881. It owes its intense color and distinct flavor to four types of malt. The Porter beer recipe is the work of the masters of the Żywiec Brewing School, who have been working in the Archduke's breweries in Żywiec and Cieszyn for generations.

name: Książęce Pszeniczne
description: Książęce Złote Pszeniczne 4.9% is a Polish wheat beer, available in a 500 ml bottle. It is characterized by a refreshing, slightly sour taste with notes of citrus, bananas and a delicate aroma of cloves. This beer goes perfectly with light dishes, salads and fish, and also works as a refreshing drink for summer days. It tastes best chilled to a temperature of 6-8°C, offering a pleasant taste experience.

name: Żywiec Porter Bałtycki
description: Żywiec Porter beer is a very strong and full-bodied beer with an aftertaste of roasted malt with coffee and caramel notes. Dark Beer brewed in Żywiec since 1881. It owes its intense color and distinct flavor to four types of malt. The Porter beer recipe is the work of the masters of the Żywiec Brewing School, who have been working in the Archduke's breweries in Żywiec and Cieszyn for generations.

name: Perła Export
description: A refreshing beer that is the quintessence of traditional production methods and the latest solutions used in brewing. It has a characteristic, strong taste, golden color and a subtle smell of aromatic hops. These advantages mean that Perła Export is mostly chosen by young consumers.

name: Książęce Ciemne
description: One beer, so many flavors! Piwo Książęce Dark Porter is a drink with a rich profile. Four types of malt are used in its brewing: Pilsner, caramel, Munich and roasted, and two varieties of hops. That's why the taste of this beer includes caramel and chocolate, as well as coffee and tart fruit.

name: Amber Ale
description: Amber beer showcases a medium-high to high malt character with medium to low caramel character derived from the use of roasted crystal malts.

name: Łomża Mocne
description: Łomża Mocne is a product with a well-established tradition. Its deep hop flavor makes it highly appreciated by experienced connoisseurs of Łomża beers.

name: Wojak Premium
description: Wojak is a proper lager dedicated to young, spirited guys who care about loyalty and brotherhood. Delightfully beery taste, excellent drinkability and right alcohol content (5%). Perfect for get-togethers with friends. In a nutshell, Wojak is a 5% lager for the young and spirited spending time with their mates.

name: Warka jasne pełne Classic
description: Warka Classic Light beer is based on a classic and original recipe. Its composition is based on aromatic Magnum hops. The drink contains 5.5% vol. alcohol. It is mild in taste and slightly effervescent. This is the perfect position for social gatherings during barbecues or dance evenings. Every gourmet will love this classic taste of beer that has been produced for several hundred years! Warka Classic Light beer is a pasteurized drink and contains barley malt and barley, which is also classically brewed and aged. Once delivered to princes, now delivered to your home!

name: Harnaś
description: Light beer in a convenient can is an alcoholic drink that will not only quench your thirst, but will also be an interesting addition to a barbecue or match. This is a noble lager beer with a truly masculine character. The drink is distinguished by its beautiful color, which looks beautiful in a tall glass, encouraging consumption thanks to the combination of golden liquid and impressive foam. Harnaś is a beer that pleases with its unique taste and aroma, bringing refreshment, cheerfulness and great mood.

name: Kasztelan Jasne Pełne
description: light amber color, full clarity, tempting foam, intense bitterness and a unique hop note in the aroma bouquet, all this from the ecologically clean area of ​​Masovia and Kujawy, from the best natural ingredients (own malt, Oligocene water).

name: Kasztelan Mocne
description: The dark amber color, intense bitterness and abundant thick foam along with the high content of extract and alcohol make Kasztelan Mocne liked by those beer lovers for whom not only the taste, but also the strength of beer is important.
